references.paper_title: 3d gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper introduces 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS), the technique upon which this work is directly built and aims to improve upon.

references.paper_title: NeRF: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduces Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), a foundational approach in novel view synthesis that 3DGS seeks to improve in terms of rendering speed.

references.paper_title: Compact 3d gaussian representation for radiance field
references.reason: This paper is a predecessor of the OMG technique, and serves as an important baseline for the current work that aims to further improve compression efficiency.

references.paper_title: Locality-aware gaussian compression for fast and high-quality rendering
references.reason: This paper presents LocoGS, which is a key state-of-the-art compression method for 3D Gaussians to which OMG is compared.

references.paper_title: Mini-splatting: Representing scenes with a constrained number of gaussians
references.reason: The OMG model implementation is based on this framework, so it serves as an important base model to this new implementation of optimized gaussian splatting.
